note.p: Birth Place: Erfurt or Heidelberg, Germany (30 January 1708 or 09 September 1710)

Career: Dr Christopher Trew (FRS 1746) bought two of his pictures for 4,000 gulder, which Ehret used to funds his travels; employed by Bernard de Jussieu (FRS 1727) in Paris; met Linnaeus in Holland; came to England and obtained the patronage of Dr Richard Mead (FRS 1703) and Sir Hans Sloane (FRS 1685) (1740); the genus Ehretia was named after him
References: Ruth Stungo, 'Recording the Aloes at Chelsea - a Singular Solution to a Difficult Problem' in NR 1996 vol 50 pp 47-57
Ruth Stungo;' Portraying Plants; botanical illustrators at The Chelsea Physic Garden'. 1995 Tracts 846/5
Gerta Calmann; 'EHRET: Flower Painter Extraordinary' 1977 Biog EHR-large
Colin Murdoch; 'G.D.Ehret, botanical artist; a tribute to his genius'. 1970 Tracts 743/3
